intro: Eliopia serrata, commonly known as the serrated eliopia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Eliopia serrata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing food for insects and contributing to soil stability.
